comment: Two ways of expressing substitution when ` y ` is not free in ` ph ` . The implication "to the left" is ~ equs4 and does not require the non-freeness hypothesis. Theorem ~ sb56 replaces the non-freeness hypothesis with a disjoint variable condition and ~ equs5 replaces it with a distinctor as antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 25-Apr-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2016.)
